original_title: Sri Lanka tourism revenues up 22-pct in March 2023
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s estimated tourism revenues grew 22 percent to 198.1 million US dollars in March 2023 from a year earlier, as arrivals continued to recover, official data show.
The tourism revenue numbers are based on a survey conducted by the  tourism promotion office and is released by the central bank.
Estimated tourism revenues for the first quarter of the 2023 was 529.8 million US dollars, up from 482.4 million US dollars a year earlier.
Tourism revenues boosts income of workers, hotel owners, transport operators and restaurants, pushing up economic activity and imports.

However since all workers and business owners save some money, the central bank could sell sterilization securities (a part of its bill stock) in to the banking system, slow credit prevent some of the inflows being turned into domestic investment and build reserves.  (Colombo/Apr07/2023)
